ssc
Class RestfulClient

java.lang.Object
  ssc.RestfulClient

 class RestfulClient
extends java.lang.Object

This is our restful client used be Sense Smart City. Currently it only GET requests is implemented. No data can be sent upstreams. It should only be used for Sense Smart City since it make a few assumptions about the server. The server is assumed to use a self-signed SSL certificate. User name and password mandatory and not an option. Note that JSON is not processed at all in this class. Known errors is wrapped into SSCExceptions.

Author:
Jim Gunnarsson, di98jgu

ignoreHost

private static javax.net.ssl.HostnameVerifier ignoreHost
This class is needed to prevent the java.io.IOException "HTTPS hostname wrong error" due to self-signed SSL certificate.

trustAll

private static javax.net.ssl.TrustManager[] trustAll
This is a trust all manager for SSL certificate. The server is self-signed and this is the standard solution. Note that getAcceptedIssuers should NOT return null according to official documentation but may return a empty array.

Method Detail

getData

public java.lang.String getData(java.lang.String url,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> args)
                         throws SSCException
Make a GET request to server. User and password is always used.

Parameters:
url - Address to host
args - Query map
Returns:
A JSON respons object
Throws:
SSCException - used for all other exceptions
SSCException.ConnectionFailed - if a connection can't be establish.
SSCException.ClientError
SSCException.ConnectionFailed - for response code 4xx
SSCException.ServerError - for response code 5xx
SSCException.Mystery - Exception at places no exception is expected

mangleResponse

private void mangleResponse(javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection connection)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Mangle the response code. If everything is fine, code 200, this method just return without any return value. If connection failed or server can't handle the request a error is thrown.

Parameters:
connection - The URLConnection
Throws:
SSCException.ClientError - for response code 4xx
SSCException.ServerError - for response code 5xx
SSCException.Mystery - Errors unknown to us
java.io.IOException - HttpsURLConnection may throw this one

queryString

private java.lang.String queryString(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> request)
This return GET request parameters, that everything after the '?' including the '?' it self. This method do at this moment a very crude work. No checks just line them up. Not critical since we have almost absolute control over what goes here. FIXME: Method encode in java.net.URLEncoder has been deprecated

Parameters:
request - Mapped key value parameters
Returns:
The GET request parameters as a string.

toString

private java.lang.String toString(java.io.InputStream stream)
                           throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                  java.io.IOException
Read stream and return a UTF-8 encoded string. While not yet confirmed it is likely that the returned JSON object is in UTF-8. This method make no assumptions about content of the stream and thus tries to encode anything as UTF-8.

Parameters:
stream - A InputStream
Returns:
String encoded in UTF-8
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if this method fails to encode received data as UTF-8
java.io.IOException - Any IO error
